input_source_clips: Path to the folder containing your input video clips (MP4, AVI, MOV, MKV).
input_source_clips_folder: Browse for a folder containing multiple video clips to process in batch.
input_source_clips_file: Select a single video clip file to process.
input_depth_maps: Path to the folder containing your pre-rendered depth maps. Depth maps should be named 'videoname_depth.mp4' matching your input videos.
input_depth_maps_folder: Browse for a folder containing corresponding depth maps (e.g., video_name_depth.mp4/npz) for batch processing.
input_depth_maps_file: Select a single depth map file corresponding to the selected source video.
output_splatted: Path to the folder where the splatted output videos will be saved.
multi_map: Enable Multi-Map mode to use subfolders within the Input Depth Maps folder. Each subfolder containing *_depth.mp4 files will appear as a selectable option. Sidecars are stored in a 'sidecars' subfolder. Shortcut: 7 and 9 switches maps.
preview_fast_forward: Fast Forward (step 5 frames). Shortcut: Shift+Spacebar (Spacebar pauses)
preview_loop: Loop playback. When reaching the end, wrap to the first frame and continue.
enable_full_res: When checked, will generate a splatted video at the original resolution of the input video. Use this for blending over the inpaint.
full_res_batch_size: The number of frames to process simultaneously when generating the full-resolution output. A higher value uses more VRAM but can be faster. Adjust based on your GPU's memory. Too high a value will bog down ffmpeg encode.
enable_low_res: When checked, will generate a splatted video of specified resolution. Use this for inpainting.
low_res_width: The target width for the low-resolution output. The input video and depth maps will be resized to this width for the low-resolution pass.
low_res_height: The target height for the low-resolution output. The input video and depth maps will be resized to this height for the low-resolution pass.
low_res_batch_size: The number of frames to process simultaneously when generating the low-resolution output. Can often be higher than the full-resolution batch size due to lower memory requirements. Too high a value will bog down ffmpeg encode.
dual_output: If checked, will generate dual panel for inpaint right eye only. Unchecked will generate quad panel for complete low-res stereo SBS after inpainting. Use this(Dual) to save on resources and manual blending.
splat_test: Saves an SBS PNG image and separate render/preview splat images. For testing Preview/Render Parity.
map_test: Saves an SBS PNG image and separate render/preview depthmap images. For testing Preview/Render Parity.
process_length: Set how many frames to process before moving on to the next video, used for testing. Set -1 to process all frames.
output_crf: Constant Rate Factor (CRF) for H.264/H.265 video encoding. Lower values mean higher quality and larger file sizes. A good starting point is 18 for high quality, 23 for good quality. Range is typically 0-51.
color_tags_mode: Writes color metadata tags into output file headers (primaries/transfer/matrix/range). Auto uses detected tags when available; otherwise falls back to BT.709. This changes metadata only. Increases compatability.
auto_convergence_toggle: EXPERIMENTAL: Simple auto convergence derived from 75% center region and averaged or peak throughout the clip.
depth_dilate_size_x: Horizontal Dilate for the Depthhmask. Bilinear blending for decimals. 0 to disable. Below 0 applies erosion.
depth_dilate_size_y: Vertical Dilate for the Depthhmask. Bilinear blending for decimals. 0 to disable. Below 0 applies erosion.
depth_blur_size_x: Horizontal Blur for the Depth Mask.
depth_blur_size_y: Vertical Blur for the Depth Mask.
depth_dilate_left: Expands depth values ONLY to the left. Useful for smoothing blocky left edges without effecting right edges or forward-warp holes. Fractional values blend smoothly like other dilates.
depth_blur_left: Blurs only around strong left-facing depth edges (ignores small gradients), to help smooth jagged left boundaries without blurring the whole depth map. Uses the H/V mix setting.
depth_blur_left_mix: Controls the balance between horizontal and vertical Blur Left. 0.0 = all horizontal, 0.5 = 50/50, 1.0 = all vertical. Recommend .5
depth_gamma: Applies a non-linear adjustment to the depth map before normalization. above 1.0 moves the midground towards the camera. Below 1.0 move further away. Set to 1.0 to disable.
max_disp: Maximum disparity value as a percentage of the video's width x 20. Higher values result in more extreme parallax effects (depth shift). Example: '30.0' means a maximum of 1.5% shift horizontally at the forground. Shortcut: 4(-) and 6(+)
convergence_point: Set to 1.0 will place depth inside the screen. 0.0 will give 100% pop out. StereoCrafter Default = 0.5, Recommend 0.8. Shortcut: 1(-) and 3(+)
border_manual: Enable manual control of parallax borders. When off, border width is automatically calculated based on Convergence and Max Disparity to correct parallax occlusion.
border_width: Total width of black borders at the screen edges as a percentage of width. Used to mask parallax occlusion for pop-out objects.
border_bias: Shift the border distribution between left and right sides. -1.0 puts all border on the left, 1.0 all on the right, 0.0 is balanced.
enable_global_normalization: Enable if your depthmap needs it and you just want to process the clips without checking.
move_to_finished_folder: When enabled, will move source input files to finished folder after processing.
crosshair_enabled: Overlay a small crosshair at the center of the preview window at Zero Parallax (screen center). Useful for setting convergence. Preview only.
crosshair_white: Use a white crosshair instead of black (helpful on dark scenes).
crosshair_multi: Adds extra bullseye targets around the center (plus guide dots) to help judge convergence. Preview-only; not exported.
depth_pop_readout: Show Depth-Pop (+parallax/-parallax) separation as % of screen width for the current frame in anaglyph preview. Preview only.
override_sidecar_preview: If sidecar file exist, it will be displayed with those settings, This checkbox will allow you to override and save/edit your current settings
start_single_button: Start performs the depth splatting on current preview clip.
start_button: Starts the batch processing: loads videos, depth maps, and performs the depth splatting.
process_from: Optional: Enter a starting video number (1-based) to begin processing from that point in the list. Leave empty to start from the beginning.
process_to: Optional: Enter an ending video number (1-based) to stop processing at that point in the list. Leave empty to process to the end.
stop_button: Stops the currently running processing task cleanly.
preview_auto_converge: Runs the Auto-Convergence pre-pass on the current preview clip. The calculated value overrides the Convergence Point slider. Requires Auto-Convergence Mode to be 'Average' or 'Peak'.
update_sidecar_button: Saves/Edit the current depth setting to the to the sidecar file for inpainting_gui to process. Shortcut: Enter
skip_lowres_preproc: EXPERIMENTAL: Skip depthmap dilation/erosion/blur for low-res splatting. Also skips the resize to clip-resolution parity path for the low-res pass.
